intro: Ilex vismiifolia, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Ilex vismiifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and year-round appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings.
